intro: Scleromitrion hispidum, commonly known as the hairy leathery fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, leathery, and hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a compact rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or white in color. Scleromitrion hispidum thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
